name: Snarkov
description: A Sinatra-based Markov bot for Slack.

OUTGOING_WEBHOOK_TOKEN.description: The token of the Slack outgoing webhook you'll use for this. Set it up at https://slack.com/services/new/outgoing-webhook. Make sure you don't set up a keyword. You'll have to point it to this app's URL once it's deployed.

API_TOKEN.description: The Slack API key. Get it at https://api.slack.com/#auth

RESPONSE_CHANCE.description: The probability that the bot will reply whenever someone speaks in the Slack room.

MAX_WORDS.description: The maximum length of the bot's replies.

SLACK_USER.description: If you want to only store messages from a certain user, put their Slack username here. If blank, it stores everyone's messages.

REPLY_REGEX.description: The bot will reply to messages matching this regex

IGNORE_REGEX.description: The bot will not store messages matching this regex

MUTE_REGEX.description: The bot will mute if this message is received

SEND_TWEETS.description: Do you want the bot to tweet everything it says? (You'll need to set up all the Twitter API stuff at https://apps.twitter.com first.)

TWITTER_API_KEY.description: Twitter API key. Required if you want the bot to tweet what it says.

TWITTER_API_SECRET.description: Twitter API secret. Required if you want the bot to tweet what it says.

TWITTER_TOKEN.description: Twitter access token. Required if you want the bot to tweet what it says.

TWITTER_TOKEN_SECRET.description: Twitter access token secret. Required if you want the bot to tweet what it says.
